docs.title: Home
docs.text:
BrayMLOps — Deep Dives

Databricks, ETL/ELT, AWS solutions, and stock analytics — published with a Databricks‑inspired MkDocs Material skin.

Databricks AWS Markdown‑first

Use Mermaid for pipelines and commit SVG for architecture diagrams.

Repo‑friendly

Text diffs, PR reviews, and CI via mkdocs gh-deploy or GitHub Actions.

Databricks patterns

Bronze → Silver → Gold, expectations, error paths, and SLAs.

AWS‑ready

IAM federation, Glue Catalog, Athena, Druid, and MLflow.

Figure: Lakehouse architecture (exported as SVG).

docs.title: AWS
docs.text: Content coming soon. Aligning with Markdown‑first diagrams (Mermaid) and SVG exports.

docs.title: Databricks Deep Dive — Lakehouse Patterns, DLT & SQL
docs.text:
What this page covers

A pragmatic reference you can skim during interviews or reuse in projects: ingestion → quality → medallion modeling → governance → performance → cost. Examples are SQL‑first, with quick tabs for Python where helpful.

docs.title: TL;DR Architecture (Medallion + Governance)

subgraph Ingestion K[[Kafka / Kinesis Streams]] Batch[[Batch Files]] end

K -->|Auto Loader| B Batch -->|COPY| L --> B B -->|Dedupe + Watermark| S S -->|Aggregations| G G --> ATH G --> Druid[(Druid)] ML((MLflow Tracking)) --> G IAM -.-> GL
